Solution:   Create a function reference.  Check argument count.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/221fcc741a6660bfc3fd0d64937d0c15bb71f51d|patch 8.2.0697: Vim9: memory leak when using nested function>
patch 8.2.0697: Vim9: memory leak when using nested function

Problem:    Vim9: memory leak when using nested function.
Solution:   Unreference function when deleting instructions. Adjust reference
            count for local variables.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0697: Vim9: memory leak when using nested function · vim/vim@221fcc7
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0697: Vim9: memory leak when using nested function · vim/vim@221fcc7
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: memory leak when using nested function. Solution: Unreference function when deleting instructions. Adjust reference count for local variables.

Solution:   Test exception from error.  Do not continue after :echoerr.
